description: The noun is probably from middle (noun) +‎ -ing; the adjective is most likely derived from the noun, and the adverb from the adjective.

adjectives.description: middling (comparative more middling, superlative most middling)

entries.meaning: Of intermediate or average size, position, or quality; mediocre.
examples: The football team is never the worst or best in its league; its position is always middling.

entries.meaning: (colloquial, regional Britain) In fairly good health.

adverbs.description: middling (comparative more middling, superlative most middling)

examples: Iwami, otherwise Sekisju, is two days journey long, going from ſouth to north, a middling good country, producing plenty of cannib, and affording ſome ſalt.

entries.meaning: (colloquial, regional Britain) Not too badly, with modest success.

definitionGroups.group: Something of intermediate or average size, position, or quality.

entries.meaning: (in the plural) Preceded by the: people of moderate means; members of the middle class.
